name: Chocolate Bread
description: This chocolate bread has a wonderful hot chocolate flavor when toasted. Not overly sweet which makes it great for snacking. Serve warm, toasted with tea or coffee.

recipeInstructions.text: Warm the water to just about warm to touch and add yeast and 1 teaspoons sugar to it. Mix well and keep for 10 minutes or until frothy.
recipeInstructions.name: Warm the water to just about warm to touch and add yeast and 1 teaspoons sugar to it. Mix well and keep for 10 minutes or until frothy.

recipeInstructions.text: Warm the milk and add cocoa powder to it and mix well and keep aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Warm the milk and add cocoa powder to it and mix well and keep aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Grease the mixer bowl, add the flours, salt and rest of the sugar and give it a whirl.
recipeInstructions.name: Grease the mixer bowl, add the flours, salt and rest of the sugar and give it a whirl.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the butter, molasses, egg, cinnamon, vanilla, cocoa and yeast mixture and knead for 10-12 minutes( batches of 3-4 minutes with intermittent scraping of the bowl). You can add half a cup of chocolate chips as well before starting the kneading. Add more flour or water if needed.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the butter, molasses, egg, cinnamon, vanilla, cocoa and yeast mixture and knead for 10-12 minutes( batches of 3-4 minutes with intermittent scraping of the bowl). You can add half a cup of chocolate chips as well before starting the kneading. Add more flour or water if needed.

recipeInstructions.text: Knead into a soft dough and place dough in a well greased container. Spritz some water and oil spray on the dough. Cover with damp towel and let rise for an hour.
recipeInstructions.name: Knead into a soft dough and place dough in a well greased container. Spritz some water and oil spray on the dough. Cover with damp towel and let rise for an hour.

recipeInstructions.text: Punch the dough down and knead for a minute. Shape into a loaf by pulling on alls ides and tucking under. Use some flour to make the dough less sticky if needed.
recipeInstructions.name: Punch the dough down and knead for a minute. Shape into a loaf by pulling on alls ides and tucking under. Use some flour to make the dough less sticky if needed.

recipeInstructions.text: Place loaf on well greased bread pan and cover with damp towel and let rise for 40 minutes in a warm place.
recipeInstructions.name: Place loaf on well greased bread pan and cover with damp towel and let rise for 40 minutes in a warm place.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove towel, spritz top with water and bake at 370 degrees F for 35-40minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove towel, spritz top with water and bake at 370 degrees F for 35-40minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove bread from pan and cool on wire rack. Cool completely before slicing. I usually slice it after keeping it in the refrigerator for an hour so it is a bit firm and the slices come out firm without falling apart!
